title: 150 Followers Question
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are there, where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"100 ≤ x ≤ 2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divisible by 3 or 8, but\nnot by 6?"}]}]}

title: 150 Friends Problem
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large f(x)= x^{150} + x^{2} -7x + 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x_{1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x_{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x_{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\ldots"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x_{150}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the roots of the above equation. Define"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large S = \huge \sum_{i=1}^{150}\dfrac{1}{(1+x_{i})^{2}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" |S| "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x_{1}, x_{2}, \ldots x_{150}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are the roots of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x) = (x-x_{1})(x-x_{2}) \ldots (x-x_{150})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Differentiating it w.r.t "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and dividing it with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". We get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{f'(x)}{f(x)} = \sum_{i=1}^{150} \dfrac{1}{x-x_{i}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Differentiating again w.r.t "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". We get,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{(f'(x))^{2} - f(x)f''(x)}{f^2 (x)} = - \sum_{i=1}^{150}\dfrac{1}{\left(x -x_{i}\right)^{2}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Taking "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = -1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we get, 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{(f'(-1))^{2} - f(-1)f''(-1)}{f^2 (-1)} = - \sum_{i=1}^{150}\dfrac{1}{\left(-1 -x_{i}\right)^{2}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"But we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(-1) = 10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f'(-1) = -159"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f''(-1) = 22352"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Substituting  and solving them we get,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S = \sum_{i=1}^{150}\dfrac{1}{\left(1 +x_{i}\right)^{2}} = -1982.39"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"|S| = \boxed{1982.39}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"let t=1/1+x
    =>x=(1-t)/t
sub  x=(1-t)/t in f(x)=o
we get,
     (1-t)^{150}+t^{148}*(1-t)^{2}-7t^{149}(1-t)+t^{150}=0
we get binomial expansion given the pic.
      "},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/A6vGutg7Ba-img_20150903_193723.jpg?width=1200"}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/0NPg2OCu7E-img_20150903_193805.jpg?width=1200"}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/rPO1c8k3yR-img_20150903_193738.jpg?width=1200"}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/nka2x4MBpK-img_20150903_193728.jpg?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 150 Friends Problem - 2

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"150150=2\times3\times5^2\times7\times11\times13"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Excepting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",the remaining 5 elements are distinguishable and the number of ways to arrange them into 6 different variables is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6^5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
In these "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6^5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" arrangements,"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" indistinguishable "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are to be arranged into 6 different variables. By "},{"type":"text","text":"Stars and Bars","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"  there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \binom{6+2-1}{2} = 21"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ways to arrange them
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 6^5 \times 21 = 163296 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Thanks for the answer Mr Bhagyanath. But doesn’t it look a bit odd that a number (150150) can have more(than itself) ways to achieve itself by multiplication of its factors (163296)?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"My solution is same as Vishnu but just more general."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let this be our problem - "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle a_1 a_2 a_3 \cdots a_m = n = p_1^{\alpha_1} p_2^{\alpha_2} \cdots p_n^{\alpha_n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, one can see that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle a_i = p_1^{x_{i,1}} p_2^{x_{i,2}} \cdots p_n^{x_{i,n}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \prod_i{a_i} = p_1^{\alpha_1} p_2^{\alpha_2} \cdots p_n^{\alpha_n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which gives us that "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle x_{1,j} + x_{2,j} + x_{3,j} + \cdots + x_{m,j} = \alpha_j , x_{k,j}\geq 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"giving us the number of solutions for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \alpha_j"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by generating functions "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle = \dbinom{m + \alpha_j -1}{m-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"and the similar results will be there for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s, thus giving by Law of multiplication,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \text{Total number of solutions for} (a_1 a_2 a_3 \cdots a_m = n) = \prod_{j=1}^{n}{\dbinom{m+\alpha_j-1}{m-1}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In general, let the prime decomposition of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n = p_1^{e_1}\cdot p_2^{e_2}\cdots p_k^{e_k}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 < p_1 < p_2 < \dots < p_n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Each prime factor must be assigned to one of the six factors "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a, b, c, d, e, f"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". If there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" factors "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then this assignment can be made in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\left(\begin{array}{c} 5+e_i \\ 5 \end{array}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ways. Multiplying gives
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = \left(\begin{array}{c} 5+e_1 \\ 5 \end{array}\right) \cdot \left(\begin{array}{c} 5+e_2 \\ 5 \end{array}\right) \cdots \left(\begin{array}{c} 5+e_n \\ 5 \end{array}\right)."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n = 150150"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"150150 = 150\times 1100 = 2\times 3 \times 5^2 \times 7 \times 11 \times 13,"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
so that
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = \left(\begin{array}{c} 6 \\ 5 \end{array}\right)^5 \cdot  \left(\begin{array}{c} 7 \\ 5 \end{array}\right) = 6^5\times 21 = 163296."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
